summary: REQ-17 is partially evidenced: WhatToExpect.tsx now contains copy emphasizing active participation, invites note-taking, and explicitly states sessions are intentionally not recorded. However, the diff is truncated and does not show the "After the Session" subsection nor confirm removal of all other landing-page mentions of recordings. Additionally, non-requested documentation/metadata updates appear in frontend-file-summaries.txt and project_state.json.

missing_requirements.requirement: In the "After the Session" subsection of frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx, remove the paragraph about receiving a recording within 24 hours and replace it with copy emphasizing active presence/engagement, inviting note-taking, and stating recordings are intentionally not provided.
missing_requirements.reason: The provided diff for WhatToExpect.tsx is truncated before showing the "After the Session" subsection, so the required replacement cannot be verified from the available evidence.

missing_requirements.requirement: No other landing-page sections contain any remaining promise or implication that a recording will be provided after the session.
missing_requirements.reason: Only WhatToExpect.tsx is shown (and truncated). No evidence is provided for other landing-page components/sections, so global removal of recording promises cannot be verified.

hallucinated_features.description: Updated/added broad documentation-like summaries describing multiple components (e.g., Hero CTA removed, multiple sections 'updated to 90 minutes', extensive design/UX descriptions).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest is a copy-only change focused on removing the recording promise and updating participation copy; it does not request updating repository summary files or describing unrelated component changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Updated project state metadata/summary describing overall app features and behavior.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request changes to project_state.json; requirement scope is limited to landing-page copy updates (WhatToExpect.tsx) without altering flows.
